name: Sabadilla
Relationship: Complementary: SEPIA. Compare: VERATRINE (is alkaloid of Sabadilla, NOT of Veratrum, locally in neuralgias, and for removal of dropsy. Five grains to two drams. Lanolin, rubbed on inside of thighs, causes diuresis). COLCH.; NUX; ARUNDO AND POLLANTIN. PHLEUM PRATENSE - Timothy - Hay-fever - Potentized - 12 - specific to many cases and evidently acts in a desensitizing manner. (Rabe.) CUMARINUM (hay-fever).Antidotes: PULS.; LYCOP.; CONIUM; LACH.

Head: Vertigo with sensation as though all things were turning around each other, accompanied by blackness before eyes and sensation of fainting
Dullness and oppression
Over-sensitiveness to odors
THINKING produces headaches and sleeplessness
EYELIDS RED, BURNING
LACHRYMATION
Difficult hearing
Fever: Heat in head and face; hands and feet icy cold, with chill
Stomach: Spasmodic pain in stomach with dry cough and difficult breathing
Canine appetite for sweets and rainaceous food
Mind: Imagines that he is very sick; that parts are shrunken; that she is pregnant; that she has cancer; delirium during intermittents
Nose: CORYZA, with severe frontal pains and redness of eyes and lachrymation
Female: Menses too late; come by fits and starts
Throat: Sensation of a skin hanging loosely; must swallow it
Sensation of a lump in throat with CONSTANT necessity to swallow
Chronic sore throat; worse, from cold air
Extremities: Cracking of skin under and beneath toes; inflammation under toe-nails

details: Action on mucous membrane of the nose and the lachrymal glands, producing coryza and symptoms like HAY-FEVER, which have been utilized homeopathically. CHILLINESS; sensitive to cold. Ascarides, with reflex symptoms (nymphomania; convulsive symptoms). Children's diarrhoea with constant cutting pains.
